verses.roman:
tasyānudhāvato retaś
caskandāmogha-retasaḥ
śuṣmiṇo yūthapasyeva
vāsitām anudhāvataḥ

synonyms: tasya—of him (Lord Śiva); anudhāvataḥ—who was following; retaḥ—the semen; caskanda—discharged; amogha-retasaḥ—of that person whose discharge of semen never goes in vain; śuṣmiṇaḥ—mad; yūthapasya—of a male elephant; iva—just like; vāsitām—to a female elephant able to conceive pregnancy; anudhāvataḥ—following.
translation: Just as a maddened bull elephant follows a female elephant who is able to conceive pregnancy, Lord Śiva followed the beautiful woman and discharged semen, even though his discharge of semen never goes in vain.
